channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Live Briefing: Israeli airstrike hits clinic in Gaza humanitarian zone, charity says
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall
item.description: Doctors Without Borders said that a strike in Mawasi caused a “huge” explosion and destroyed equipment at its clinic. Israel said it was targeting weaponry.

item.title: Israel prepares Lebanon cease-fire plan as ‘gift’ to Trump, officials say
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Suzan Haidamous, John Hudson

item.title: Trump pick resurfaces questions about Tulsi Gabbard’s 2017 Syria visit
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The meetings with Syrian President Bashar al-Assad hung over Gabbard, Trump’s choice for director of national intelligence, as she ran for president in 2020.

item.title: 2 patients in ambulance killed by vigilantes, police in Haiti, aid group says
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Baker
item.description: Law enforcement officers and a vigilante group attacked a Doctors Without Borders ambulance amid a broader crisis of violence plaguing Haiti.

item.title: Israel prepares Lebanon cease-fire plan as ‘gift’ to Trump, officials say
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Suzan Haidamous, John Hudson
item.description: An Israeli government minister discussed the proposal with Trump and Jared Kushner at Mar-a-Lago on Sunday before traveling to the White House for talks.

item.title: Trump taps Rubio for secretary of state. What are his foreign policy views?
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands, Karen DeYoung
item.description: Donald Trump said Sen. Marco Rubio of Florida will be secretary of state. Here’s where Rubio stands on the Israel-Gaza and Russia-Ukraine wars, NATO and more.

item.title: IDF strikes Beirut’s southern suburbs; Israeli ministers welcome Trump Cabinet picks
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Vivian Ho
item.description: The Israel Defense Forces said it struck facilities used by Hezbollah for military purposes after the group fired more rockets across the Lebanese border.

item.title: Ukraine’s European allies eye once-taboo ‘land-for-peace’ negotiations
item.dc:creator: Ellen Francis
item.description: European allies are increasingly bracing for negotiations on Russia’s war in Ukraine that could include territorial concessions in return for security guarantees for Kyiv.

item.title: Trump appointees signal a new hawkish China policy
item.dc:creator: Cate Cadell, Ellen Nakashima
item.description: Trump’s potential appointees Marco Rubio, Mike Waltz and Elise Stefanik at State Department, National Security Council and United Nations signal a hawkish China policy.

item.title: Blinken helms last-minute rush of support to Ukraine before Trump takes office
item.dc:creator: Michael Birnbaum
item.description: Trump has vowed to put a quick end to Russia’s war in Ukraine, which Kyiv and some European capitals believe could force Ukraine to make painful concessions.

item.title: Blinken says Israel did not fully address U.S. concerns over Gaza
item.dc:creator: Michael Birnbaum, Rebecca Tan

item.title: Israeli forces target Beirut suburb, issue evacuation warnings
item.dc:creator: Vivian Ho

item.title: Far-right Israeli leaders welcome Trump’s latest picks for administration
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong

item.title: U.S. says no policy consequences for Israel despite lack of Gaza aid
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, John Hudson

item.title: 35 people killed in China after man rams car into crowd
item.dc:creator: Christian Shepherd, Lyric Li
item.description: Amid shock at the high death toll, officials have tried to soothe public anger with a flurry of promises to serve justice and do better to prevent future attacks.

item.title: What Trump’s emerging foreign policy team tells us about his agenda
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: In picking figures such as Marco Rubio and Fox News host Pete Hegseth for his administration, Trump may be signaling his foreign policy goals — or foreshadowing four years of chaos.

item.title: U.S. won’t withhold aid to Israel, walking back threat over conditions in Gaza
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Adela Suliman, Rebecca Tan, Adam Taylor, John Hudson
item.description: The United States will not withhold military aid from Israel, the State Department said Tuesday, despite the situation in Gaza not improving, according to aid groups and U.N. officials.

item.title: U.S. says no policy consequences for Israel despite lack of Gaza aid
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, John Hudson
item.description: A Post analysis based on more than a dozen interviews found Israel has largely failed to comply with U.S. demands, bringing parts of northern Gaza closer to famine.

item.title: Archbishop of Canterbury resigns over mishandling of abuse allegations
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam
item.description: A report found Justin Welby took insufficient action on allegations against John Smyth, believed to be “the most prolific serial abuser” associated with the Church of England.

item.title: South Korean president refreshes golf skills after years to prep for Trump
item.dc:creator: Michelle Lee, Sammy Westfall
item.description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol is preparing for the return of golf diplomacy under President-elect Donald Trump.

item.title: Far-right Israeli minister welcomes Mike Huckabee as Trump pick for ambassador
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor

item.title: U.S. won’t withhold military aid from Israel as deadline for Gaza aid surge passes
item.dc:creator: John Hudson, Adela Suliman, Lior Soroka

item.title: Emperor penguin found on Australian beach, thousands of miles from home
item.dc:creator: Vivian Ho
item.description: The emperor penguin was found on an Australian beach near the coastal town of Denmark, more than 2,200 miles from its Antarctic habitat.

item.title: Germany set for early elections in February after government collapse
item.dc:creator: Kate Brady
item.description: The decision follows a budget fight that prompted Chancellor Olaf Scholz to fire his finance minister and announce a confidence vote that is widely expected to fail.

item.title: The U.S. demanded that Israel surge aid to Gaza. Little has changed.
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger

item.title: Food delivery to northern Gaza reduced and delayed, U.N. agency says
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan

item.title: As Trump prepares for mass deportations, Mexico is not ready
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan, Gabriela Martínez
item.description: Mexicans make up half of immigrants living illegally in the U.S. The country could be the most vulnerable to a new Trump policy to deport the undocumented.

item.title: Saudi crown prince accuses Israel of committing genocide
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Adela Suliman
